decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:
Flood Risk Assessment, Ecological Assessment, Reasonable Exception Statement, AD85-03-1002, AD85-03-1001, AD85-03-1003 (Flood Risk Assessment Drainage Plans AD85-03-1002B, AD85-03-1003C                        
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall not commence until the following details have been submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority: 

A) brief method statement to set out measures that will be undertaken (a) in preparation for and during construction to protect wildlife from harm and (b) to ensure that contractors and their overseers are aware of and will implement these.

B) Details of the type, location and installation of wildlife shelters to be incorporated within the fabric of the extended building, or as otherwise agreed in writing with the Council in advance, to include but not necessarily be limited to the provision of three `bird brickï¿½ next boxes on the North  and East aspects of the extended building at just below roof eaves level. 

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details as so agreed and retained thereafter. 

REASON: To ensure proper planning, avoid uncertainty, and protect and enhance biodiversity in accordance with local planning policies DM20 and DM21, the London Plan G6 and the National Planning Policy Framework, providing measurable gain for the environment.
Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the side elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.

REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 6 - The window(s) in the side elevation(s) of the proposed development shall:
(a) be of purpose-made obscure glass,
(b) be permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level,
and shall thereafter be retained in that form.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 7 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Single storey front extension; single and two storey rear extension; alterations to roof; rear dormer; rooflight in rear roofslope; conversion of garage to habitable room with installation of window to front; external alterations
